intro: Pavonia pseudoarabica, commonly known as the white crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and adaptability contribute to its appeal in both natural and cultivated landscapes.
